snippet: Several statements from suspects in murder cases investigated by Louis Scarcella, a retired detective now facing scrutiny, used the phrases, “I was there,” or “you got it right.”
abstract: Several statements from suspects in murder cases investigated by retired New York City Police Detective Louis Scarcella now face scrutiny for using similar phrases, leading to questions of coercion; Scarcella was member of Brooklyn North Homicide squad who developed reputation for eliciting confessions no one else could; questions about his credibility have led district attorney's office to reopen all his trial convictions.
lead_paragraph: Several statements from suspects in murder cases investigated by Louis Scarcella, a retired detective now facing scrutiny, used the phrases, “I was there,” or “you got it right.”

headline.main: Several Murder Confessions Taken by Brooklyn Detective Have Similar Language
headline.print_headline: In Confessions Detective Took, Shared Phrases
